CLASS: A group, collection, category or set sharing characteristics or attributes.
CREAM: The butterfat/milkfat part of milk which rises to the top; this part when separated from the remainder.
CROP: A plant, especially a cereal, grown to be harvested as food, livestock fodder or fuel or for any other economic purpose.
HEAD: The part of the body of an animal or human which contains the brain, mouth and main sense organs.
LIFE: The state of organisms preceding their death, characterized by biological processes such as metabolism and reproduction and distinguishing them from inanimate objects; the state of being alive and living.
LITTER: A platform mounted on two shafts, or a more elaborate construction, designed to be carried by two (or more) people to transport one (in luxury models sometimes more) third person(s) or (occasionally in the elaborate version) a cargo, such as a religious idol.
PARTY: A person or group of people constituting a particular side in a contract or legal action.
PICK: A tool used for digging; a ____axe.
